title: Cylinder Head - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
You can not remove the cylinder head with the engine installed in the frame.
Make sure that the engine is securely mounted in an engine stand or properly supported when it is removed from the motorcycle.
If the engine is not correctly supported, it can fall.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in damage to property or serious injury.
Remove the camshaft drive chain tensioner blades.
Note the position of all tappet buckets and shims so that they can be installed in the same positions. Remove all the tappet buckets and shims.
To prevent the tappet buckets and shims from becoming mixed, place the shim and tappet together in a marked container.
The components must be refitted in their original positions.
Disconnect the coolant bypass hose from the rear of the cylinder head.
Release the screws securing the outside of the cylinder head to the upper crankcase.

body.name: Cylinder head outside two screws cdra_1

body.body: Cylinder head to upper crankcase screws
Progressively release the cylinder head bolts in the order shown below.
Use a rubber mallet to lightly tap the cylinder head to break the seal of the gasket.
Discard the cylinder head gasket, bolts and hardened washers.
